titleStmt.title: The Prologue vnto the second Booke.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: The Prologue vnto the second Booke.

monogr.title: Thule, or Vertues historie : To the honorable and vertuous Mistris Amy Audely. By F.R. The first booke
monogr.author: Rous, Francis

div.head: The Prologue vnto the second Booke.

lg.l: THus farre my lowly Muse in course aray,
She wes the least riches of her treasury;
And in the plainer tearmes she doth assay,
To please the eares of popularity.
Now shall she tread one litle step aboue,
For those whose itching eares are neuer fild:
But with the thunder of almighty Ioue,
And tales how Giants daring armes did wield.
Yet not so high, though higher then the rest,
Contents me in the Sea beare lowly sayle,
VVith litle barke, least canuas fittest best,
That can with lesser might gainst tide preuayle.
But when to greater seats she shall aspire;
Then may she boldly sing great Phlegraes fire.
